DataElement.preferredName: Complete Remission At End Second Course Therapy Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The remission status at the end of the second course of therapy determined by morphologic evaluation of marrow; <5% blast = CR

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Complete Remission At End Second Course Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured._Used to indicate position, location, or state (American Heritage Dictionary)_The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent._Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate position, location, or state (American Heritage Dictionary):The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate position, location, or state.
The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval from T.Davidsen. mc 4/18/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003_An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease)._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in apoptosis, inflammation, septic shock, and wound healing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).
An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).
A condition or state at a particular time.
